intro: Lepidagathis andersoniana, commonly known as the Anderson's lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
